integrated_gui module

Integrated PyQt5 GUI Module with Database Support

This module provides an advanced PyQt5-based graphical user interface for the school management system with integrated SQLite database support. It includes all features from the basic GUI plus database persistence, record editing, statistics, and backup functionality.

class integrated_gui.EditRecordDialog(record_type, record_data, parent=None)[source]

Bases: QDialog

Dialog window for editing student, instructor, and course records.

Provides a modal dialog interface for editing existing records in the database. Supports editing of students, instructors, and courses with appropriate form fields for each record type.

Parameters:

  • record_type (str) – Type of record being edited (‘Student’, ‘Instructor’, or ‘Course’)

  • record_data (dict) – Dictionary containing the current record data

  • parent (QWidget, optional) – Parent widget for the dialog, defaults to None

Variables:

  • record_type (str) – The type of record being edited

  • record_data (dict) – The current record data

get_data()[source]

Retrieve the edited data from the dialog form fields.

Collects and returns the data entered in the form fields, with appropriate data types and field names based on the record type.

Returns:

Dictionary containing the edited record data

Return type:

dict

init_ui()[source]

Initialize the user interface for the edit dialog.

Creates and sets up the dialog window, form fields, and buttons based on the record type. Configures appropriate input fields for students, instructors, or courses.

class integrated_gui.IntegratedSchoolManagement[source]

Bases: QMainWindow

Advanced PyQt5 application window with integrated database support.

This is the main application window that provides a comprehensive GUI interface for the school management system with SQLite database integration. It includes all features from the basic GUI plus advanced functionality like record editing, database backup/restore, statistics display, and CSV export capabilities.

Key Features: - Student, instructor, and course management with database persistence - Real-time search across all record types - Record editing through modal dialogs - Database backup and restore functionality - Data export to CSV format - System statistics and reporting - Tabbed interface for organized navigation

Variables:

  • db_manager (DatabaseManager) – Database manager instance for SQLite operations

  • system (SchoolManagementSystem) – School management system loaded from the database

  • tab_widget (QTabWidget) – Main tabbed interface container

add_course()[source]

Add a new course to the database and system.

Validates the course form inputs, creates a new Course object with optional instructor assignment, and attempts to add it to both the database and the in-memory system. If an instructor is selected, the course is also assigned to that instructor.

The method performs the following validations: - Ensures course ID and course name are provided - Validates instructor selection if provided - Checks for duplicate course IDs through the database

Raises:

  • ValueError – If validation fails or instructor not found

  • Exception – If database operation fails or other unexpected error occurs

add_instructor()[source]

Add a new instructor to the database and system.

Validates the instructor form inputs, creates a new Instructor object, and attempts to add it to both the database and the in-memory system. Provides user feedback through message boxes and refreshes displays upon successful addition.

The method performs the following validations: - Ensures all form fields are filled - Validates that age is a valid integer - Checks for duplicate instructor IDs or emails through the database

Raises:

  • ValueError – If age cannot be converted to integer or other validation fails

  • Exception – If database operation fails or other unexpected error occurs

add_student()[source]

Add a new student to the database and system.

Validates the student form inputs, creates a new Student object, and attempts to add it to both the database and the in-memory system. Provides user feedback through message boxes and refreshes displays upon successful addition.

The method performs the following validations: - Ensures all form fields are filled - Validates that age is a valid integer - Checks for duplicate student IDs or emails through the database

Raises:

  • ValueError – If age cannot be converted to integer or other validation fails

  • Exception – If database operation fails or other unexpected error occurs

create_course_tab()[source]

Create the course management tab interface.

Sets up the course tab with form fields for adding new courses, including course ID, course name, and instructor assignment dropdown with action buttons.

create_instructor_tab()[source]

Create the instructor management tab interface.

Sets up the instructor tab with form fields for adding new instructors, including name, age, email, and instructor ID inputs with proper labels and action buttons.

create_registration_tab()[source]

Create the student registration and instructor assignment tab.

Sets up the registration tab with dropdowns for student-course registration and instructor-course assignment functionality. Includes separate sections for each type of registration.

Create the student management tab interface.

Sets up the student tab with form fields for adding new students, including name, age, email, and student ID inputs with proper labels and action buttons.

init_ui()[source]

Initialize the main user interface components.

Sets up the main window properties, creates the central widget layout, and initializes all tabbed interfaces including student management, instructor management, course management, registration, data display, search functionality, and administrative tools.

load_from_json()[source]
on_search()[source]
refresh_displays()[source]

Refresh all table displays and dropdown menus with current data.

Reloads the entire system from the database and updates all GUI components to reflect the current state. This includes: - Student, instructor, and course tables - All dropdown menus for registration and assignment - Search results table

This method should be called after any database modification operation to ensure the GUI displays accurate, up-to-date information.

integrated_gui.main()[source]

Main application entry point.

Initializes the PyQt5 application, creates the main window instance, displays the window, and starts the application event loop. The application will run until the user closes the window or the process is terminated.

Raises:

SystemExit – When the application is closed, exits with the application’s exit code
